Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: asjay999
Reviews.Content: We (2) visited Barcelo Saray from March 12-15 and had an overall very pleasant stay. The staff service, the restaurant, and overall room condition and amenities were very good to excellent. The location is very close to Grand Bazar and across from Beyazit Mosque. We stayed in a room overlooking street scene and enjoyed it very much. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and relaxed hotel in a bustling neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Swifty1999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location near many of the popular sights such as the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. The staff are very friendly and accomodating, and the prices are reasonable. Our room was a standard double, which was fairly compact, but did not feel like a compromise. Entry to the hotel's own Hamam was free, but paying for a scrub/massage is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good city break hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: eaf_16
Reviews.Content: No complaints with the hotel or the room. Staff very helpful, standard modern, clean rooms. Good Turkish breakfast and hamman/sauna etc is an added bonus at the end of a long day sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Grand bazaar and wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: djdg1
Reviews.Content: Our room was upgraded to one with exceptional views over Beyazit Square and mosque. This was offered on check in for â‚¬20 but as we had a special deal with Tesco Clubcard Points Rewards Scheme already reserved the extra was not charged although the cost would be well worth it regardless of offers. Room was modern, clean, with super comfortable bed and the bathroom and most importantly the shower were funky. Hotel is in great location, just minutes from Grand Bazaar and steps from tram stop to Sultanahmet for Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia etc. Should we go back we would definitely stay here again and upgrade for the views, they really are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Diana W
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend had a three night break in Istanbul staying at the Barcelo Saray. The hotel was in the old city which is really interesting and close to all the mosques and bazaars. The hotel was modern, smart and clean. Breakfast was fantastic, there was an amazing choice all freshly prepared and the restaurant (the vista) had a stunning view to one of the mosques. The staff were very friendly and could not have been more helpful, they booked us into a theatre where we could see a whirling dervish ritual, which was amazing. On another evening they booked us into a restaurant that had live gypsy music and we also had a free taxi there and back. Nothing was too much trouble for the reception staff and it was the best service we have had anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Philippe D
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days (3 nights) in the Barcelo Saray. A very good choice. Excellent location with a beautiful view in the old part of the city. Not far away from Aya Sofia and the blue Mosque, and not to far away from the airport. The hotel is also situated along the tramway line T1. The crew is very sympathetic and effecient. Price is OK and breakfast very good. The bed in the room was also very good and we did not hear the mosk just in front of the hotel because we asked for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to explore old part of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie2406
Reviews.Content: I'd like to recommend Barcelo Saray to all travellers who plan to visit Istanbul! The hotel has perfect location - just few meters away from Old Bazar and beautiful mosques. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. Friendly and helpful staff, delicious breakfast, wonderful hamam, this hotel is truly one of my favourites!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mollyj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is very near the Grand Bazar and the tram to take you to all the touristy stuff (Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Bosphoros Cruise, Haghia Sophia) is literally outside the hotel and a short tram ride away (7-10 mins). We had a inner view - ie not looking out across towards the mosque/park, but it was very pleasant - it looked out onto a glass ceiling below, which was above the ground floor reception area. It was quiet and we were not disturbed by any noise. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a great choice. The hotel doesn't have a fitness centre or pool, but an excellent hamam (Turkish bath) with steam room, sauna, chill area and a wonderful warm large round slab where you can just lie and recharge your batteries or order a massage. Overall, a perfect choice for staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and well allocated to all their tourist spots. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: digebara
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel with knowledgeable and helpful staff who went out of their way to make our stay a lovely experience. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth coming back to!”
Reviews.Author: Runeberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us as it is Spanish (Mallorcan) and we live in Barcelona. At other times we have stayed in a small hotel in Sultanahmet. But this was a great change. The hotel is only a couple of hundred metres from the Grand Bazaar and from the central tramline. Hagia Sophia, Topkapi and the Blue Mosque are two stops away by tram. We were picked up at the airport and paid only 35 euros for a return trip. We were a bit amazed to start with as the reception is in the basement. But it was fine, with a bar, sitting areas and free computers. The staff couldnÂ´t have been more helpful, and most of them spoke both English and Spanish. At first we were given a room on the first floor which equalled street level. It was noisy and people could look in if you didnÂ´t draw the curtains. However, we were moved to the third floor to a much bigger room with a very nice view of the Beyazit Mosque. A desk for the computer (wifi free), a good bathroom, comfortable twin beds, clean. There is a restaurant on the top floor with a wide view of the old part of the city. The breakfast buffet was all right, though if you arrived late most things were finished and there was no refill, unless you pointed it out to the staff. There is a sauna and a Turkish bath which come in handy after a long walk in town and in the market. The hotel is reasonably priced so as I said in the title: ItÂ´s worth coming back to!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: alain s
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife in this hotel for 3 nights,it's a excellent choice,the staff extremely professional,simply put it is an outstanding hotel in a wonderful location,our room was very clean and comfortable,wish we will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Delusion knowing BarcelÃ² standards”
Reviews.Author: ArieLu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on last two nights of our turkish holiday. The hotel is located in the Sultan Ahmet, so very good to visit the city just walking or taking a tram. At the beginning of the holiday we stayed at Double Tree that is very close as position but really much better as quality. BarcelÃ² Saray is a old hotel, with a strange entrance (you enter in the building, then go downstairs and in a commercial zone there is the real entrance), nice common areas but old building and furnuture. You usually cannot have a very silence experience in Sultan Ahmet because of trafic jam and mujahidin calls but here windows are not very isolated and you can cleraly hear steps on upper fllor and noise coming from hallway and other rooms. Furniture ia quite old (not bad at all but surely not modern). Breakfast is also a delusion, a very big choice but low quality. Price is not cheap as other hotels in the area, but as said we experienced something surely better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value !”
Reviews.Author: Reedz
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first to book this hotel as it was situated across the tram line ,but now I realise it was a major advantage. I was travelling with my two children,husband and both parents. The location of the hotel was superb as it was just a few minutes away from the Grand Bazaar. The rooms were clean,spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was good too,though for a five night stay,i expected slightly more variety. I think they ought to also employ a chef to cook omlettes to create a better atmosphere. Other than that,it cannot be faulted . The children would have preferred having a few fast food outlets nearer the hotel as Mcd's was a long way off . We often had to find food before we entered the hotel in distant locations. Local food was plentiful nearby ,but this is not always the choice of everyone concerned. We travelled at the end of spring and the weather was therefore slightly chillly. There was no natural ventilation in the bedroom so I am pleased we had no need to open the room to the inside of the shopping mall situated below. At times,it could be a bit noisy down below but did not hamper our sleep. If shopping is your main activity,then this hotel would suit you from a grand bazaar standpoint. I would be inclined to choose a more relaxed setting next time and also a hotel which has more on offer for children i.e. Pool.

Reviews.Title: “the barcelo soray istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: suesheffield40
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. very near to all the must see attractions. The staff were very professional and attentive. Very helpful staff on the reception. I found that if I needed any advise they were very knowledgable. I am a single traveller and I must admit that the room that I was allocated was a very small room. In fact the smallest room I have ever had. Having said that the space was used wisely. It was very compact to say the least, but then I did spend most of my time out and about so I cannot say it bothered me too much. I must admit that I did miss the luxury of having some outside space i.e. a terrace to chill out on, maybe have a drink and read a book, so if that is important to you then this hotel is not for you. Overall a pleasant stay and I would stay again if I could get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: fairwindstraveler
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the Grand Bazaar & within walking distance to just about everything else you would like to see. The breakfast was lavish and they had a cappuccino machine!! We had an inside room opening into an airshaft so it was a little stuffy -- can't imagine what it would be like in the summer! But while the room was hot the steam room was cool! The hamam though was just right. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hot small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fran949
Reviews.Content: The size of the rooms particularly that occupied by our friends was disappointing. They had nowhere to put their case and were stepping over it all the time. The air conditioning had been switched off and although the hotel put it back on for us is was useless. The room was too warm to sleep properly and it opened onto an inner roofed courtyard so no fresh air was available. This was not helped by the smell from the drains in the bathroom The hotel is in a good position for sightseeing and the staff were OK. Brekfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE INSIDE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: christinaelisabeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights 15-20 October 2011. Unfortunately, for the first 3 days we had terrible weather - cold and torrential rain - not what we expected. The hotel is at first a little off-putting as it seems to be part of a small shopping mall containing bank, hairdresser, etc and the reception is in the basement. I had a problem with the first room we were shown as not only was it very small but the window opened into the internal atrium of the building which I found extremely claustrophobic. There were a large number of similar rooms. We were then given a front room but this overlooked the busy and noisy street with buses stopping just outside. We stayed one night in this room but were then given a room at the back on the 3rd floor which not only had a sea view over the rooftop of the buildings in the back street but had no outside noise at all. This was perfect. The room was sparsely furnished in a modern style with big TV but quite adequate and the bathroom had an excellent walk-in shower (no bath) which was a life-saver after the cold wet days - there were plenty of towels and toiletries provided. I agree, that the staff are very helpful and polite. The breakfast was good with lots of choice - eggs could be ordered freshly cooked with limitless tea and coffee plus cuppuccino machine - the restaurant also had an excellent view of the mosque opposite. The location for access to all the ancient well known sites was excellent - just 5 minutes away and it was easy to walk to most places or just jump on the excellent modern tramway system if you got tired. I would stay here again but only if I could be sure that I got a back room .

Reviews.Title: “Fair price , good location”
Reviews.Author: paulus70
Reviews.Content: Went with my children first and again with friends 3 months later. In front of grand bazaae , 500 meters from blue mosque, the water reservoir , the imperial palace. Near a lot of recomendable restaurants. Location location location. For 100eu.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in central location!”
Reviews.Author: Mai-Lin B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a porter and he helpfully directed us downstairs to the lobby where we checked in and were able to leave our suitcases. The staff at the desk were friendly and helpful and unexpectedly we were upgraded to a suite with a king size bed - a very pleasant and welcome surprise. Room was very clean and spacious. Bathroom was large with a jetted tub. We found this hotel to be very centrally located - very close to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, tram, and the Sultanhamel Square. There were plenty of restaurants close by. I tried a turkish massage, which was very relaxing and then tried the turkish bath (free for guests), which was very different from anything i have ever tried. i liked being the only one in the bath and it was co-ed! We didn't get to try to breakfast as our transfer to airport was very early! The view from the restaurant was lovely! We definitely would go back to this hotel again! Another pleasant surprise was having the use of a computer for emails....very handy as i had not experienced that in any of hotels in italy where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room, but charged more for aiport transfer”
Reviews.Author: SmilingSuey
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, but it is a busy street. You can hear horns honking with windows closed but it got pretty quiet at night (Room 224). Short walk to Hagia Sophia and the Sultanhamet Square. Lots of shops along the way. The breakfast buffet had a lot of selections, food was OK but not great. Price for breakfast was the same whether paid in advance with the room, or just paid on the mornings you want it (10 â‚¬ ). Kingsize bed was two twin mattresses pushed together, so there was a bump in the middle. And interestingly the blanket/comforter was only a double -- didn't ever reach across the top of the bed. Everything was very clean, the room size was nice, A/C worked great, wifi worked but was very slow. I was upset when they charged the airport transfer fee for EACH direction, when the website implies the transfer is round-trip (website says cost is 35.00 â‚¬ per room a stay). There are several websites where you can book ROUNDTRIP transfers for 35â‚¬ so I felt ripped off but they wouldn't budge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosary123
Reviews.Content: When we entered the hotel,we had a warm welcome.We are a family of five,we requested for 2 adjacent rooms..i.e.3 bedded and 2 bedded.Though it was difficult..but somehow it was arranged.The rooms were clean so also the bathrooms.The Hotel is centrally located..but the entrance to the hotel is at the basement..but thats not an issue as the rooms were comfortable and the staff was friendly.The hotel is at walking distance from the grand bazaar,Hagia Sophia,Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Turkey and the accommodation was first class.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was great and the staff were very helpful and cheerful. Baver and Mecrun were the main two staff members we had contact with and they could not do enough to help us. Nothing was too much trouble . There is a nice sauna and spa room which we did not have time to use but it looked very comfortable and the massage rates were also good. Breakfast was nice and the balcony was a nice spot to sit and look out over the streets of Istanbul whilst having breakfast. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was great and the bathroom was a good size compared to some of our other accommodation. The hotel is central to all the main tourist attractions in Istanbul so it was easy to walk everywhere. We loved the shopping and atmosphere in Istanbul and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy. Great room/food and value. Loved the massage and hamam.”
Reviews.Author: StayedHereB4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a room with a Mosqus view. The noise wasn't as bad as some indicated, or I feared. The windows are quite good. They are solid and the centre one can be opened to access the mini balcony and get fresh air. They keep the sound out and with ear plugs I didn't hear anything. I have no complaints and would recommend this place as one of the best hotels I've stay at in the past few years. I stay mainly at Bestwesterns, Days Inns, Quality Inns, so I'm happy as long as the room is clean and functional. This was beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: SSKanani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 21 nights altogether as we came for our honeymoon. We really enjoyed pretty much everything about this hotel. The staff were really nice and pleasant and very helpful at all times. The rooms were impeccably clean and the housecleaning staff were also very understanding and kind. We didn't have any problems or delays if we needed anything brought to our room. The location is good because it's only a few minutes walk from the tram, and about 20 minutes walk to the main tourist area Sultanahmet. Taxis are really easy to catch just outside the hotel as well. The room was nice and well kitted-out: the lighting and beds were perfect, the bathrooms clean and tidy, the TV was large, we weren't disturbed in our room from outside noises or neighbours. Overall the standard of the hotel is quite high, with a beautiful reception area downstairs and a cool interior to take refuge from the heat. The only complaint we had was we couldn't order pizza to our room! But other than that, everything else was fantastic. We'd definitely recommend this place to others and would come back here if we visit Istanbul again!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Amitayush
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in August. We found the hotel to be very well-located (approx 10 min walk from all the key sights in the Old City), extremely clean with a very helpful staff. The concierge was extremely patient in explaining all the sight seeing options and connecting us to tourist operators. We also had their bfast the first morning which at 10 Euros offers a great spread, largely western though with few traditional Turkish dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: SaraR25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelo Saray for tour nights during our stay in Istanbul. The hotel is conveniently located near all the major attractions so pretty much everything is within walking distance and if you're not up for a walk the tram is right across the street. The hotel staff on the other hand were a little questionable in a sense that they weren't the most helpful people. The lighting in the room we had which was one without a view was dim but aside from that it was a fair accommodation overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scoopy523
Reviews.Content: Lovely upscale hotel. Absolutely great view of the city from the rooftop restaurant. Many of the great Istanbul sites within walking distance. For the cost expected more attention to details like bathrobe and slippers. ATM conveniently located near the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a convenient, bustling location”
Reviews.Author: two_from_singapore
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel on the fringe of the old city. The tram station (Beyazit) is right in front and the Grand Bazaar is a block away. A couple of quirks you should be mindful of. First, you need to look carefully for the signboard, as the section facing the street is lined with shops and doesn't look like a hotel. You have to take the escalator down to reach the hotel lobby. Second, check that the windows in your room are closed when you check in. If they aren't, the aircon won't turn on. And, you may find it very noisy. We spent a night feeling hot and stuffy before realising the problem. The cleaners open the windows for ventilation when they clean the room, so you need to remember to close them again. We weren't the only ones - I overheard other guests finding out the hard way that their aircon wasn't on. Breakfast is on the 4th floor restaurant with a nice view of the New Mosque right in front. But as there many places to eat around the hotel, you may want to consider saving money and opting for the room-only rate. It's nice to have the tram so accessible, especially when it's too hot to walk. But it takes less than 15 minutes to walk to or from the Sultanahment sights, and it's lovely to do so on a summer evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SayedO
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Barcelo Saray was pleasant. The hotel is nice, nothing too fancy - rooms are straightforward and to the point. It is nestled nicely in Beyazit and is a 5 minute walk from the tram. The hotel staff were very knowledgeable, spoke good english and friendly. 2 staffers in particular: Baver and Arzu were immensely helpful to me through out my stay. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who is not able to splurge on a fancy 5 star spot.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: heavencanwait4me
Reviews.Content: The BarcelÃ³ Saray is very well located on the main road where the main city tram line runs and across from a lovely Mosque and only 200 meters from the Grand Bazaar and walking distance from the main historical sites. It is a modern hotel. Strangely though, the entrance is located on the lower level of a small shopping center which seems to have little if no movement. No problem with this though. Breakfast was huge with a variety for every taste and the view from the dining room was to a lovely Mosque and it also had a veranda, which is useful for smokers. The rooms were spotless and the beds comfortable. There was also air conditioning. We ordered a central courtyard room to avoid any noise and it was very quiet. We did not hear our neighbors either. There is a 4:30am prayer call which is broadcast over the city but I never heard it until the last day when our airport pickup was at 4:30. Doesn't last too long though. When one of our safes (we booked two rooms) had not been cemented in the closet and a shower was leaking, that very day, they fixed everything. The reception booked all our tours or shows we wanted and were helpful with all our queries and gave useful suggestions . Courteous and efficient. We will return to the BarcelÃ³ Saray again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: iAshutosh
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Istanbul for a short stay and want to enjoy people, fun, non-relaxing vacation, Barcelo Saray is the place to stay. The place is in the heart of Sultanahmet, yet away from the melee. So you can have great days spent around in Sultanahmet and then come back in the evening to have a peaceful night, and relax your senses in the hotel's hammam. They have a wonderful terrace restaurant and the breakfast was pretty amazing. We did not try the lunch and dinner so don't know much about that. Hotel is walking distance from the tram station, Grand Bazaar, a Grand Mosque (forgotten the name), and some really cool places to eat. If only we could have got the place cheaper than what we got, it would have been a perfect and economical Turkish holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good - but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: pdm535
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights from 8th June. Rooms are pretty small. Larger rooms were extra and worth the additional sum. Not worth paying for a room with a view of the Benayit mosque as these are really noisy. Better to be facing inner courtyard. Excellent service and breakfast. In general a good chain hotel. Great location on the tram route and opposite the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: ResidentAlien
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on vacation in Istanbul. Fantasy Travel booked it for us. The hotel is amazing -- clean, modern decor, and right in the middle of it all. A ten minute walk from all the sights in Sultanhamet, only one block from the Grand Bazaar, and right in front of the Beyazit Tram stop that can take you anywhere in the city. The staff is extremely friendly. Omar, Bover, and Arzu were all particularly helpful with restaurant recommendations, directions, and they upgraded us to a deluxe room on the top floor our last night in Istanbul. Those rooms are amazing -- with a view of the entire Bosphorus. We got a full breakfast there every morning with a view of the Beyazit Mosque. I would come back here in a heartbeat and recommend this place to anyone staying in Istanbul. Fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: resident2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Barcelo Saray with friends for four nights. The rooms were excellent. The staff was genuinely friendly and always helped us. The location is great. You are no more than a 10 minute walk to the historic sites of Sultanahment. Also there is a tram line right by the hotel that you can take to the Beyoglu district. The complementary breakfast in the morning was great. I would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the hotel and everything went exceptionally smooth. Extremely friendly and nice staff, nice room and bathroom, good service, very good breakfast, magnificent view from the breakfast-terrace, cheap price for the stay and perfect location 200 meters from the Grand Bazaar and tram-stop. The free wlan-network worked excellent on my iPad. I highly recommend this hotel if you spend a few days in Istanbul for sightseeing. The view from our room (107) was a bit disappointing, but hey, who wants to look out of the vindow when you spend all day outside?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely sensational!”
Reviews.Author: ShezM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family and friends for four nights (one night broken in between by an overnighter to Gallipoli). First impression - we were a little worried that we had to go down an escalator to get to the hotel but once we got through the hotel doors we were rapt with what we saw. Check in was smooth, porters were quick to grab our bags and get them to the rooms. The rroms were clean and well decorated (not that interior design is high on our list of priorities when travelling). There is a mosque directly across the road, so the call to prayer was quite loud but we found that we quickly got used to it. the 5am one is a wake up call, but we quickly went back to sleep as it only lasts a minute (added to our Turkish experience). With the overnight stay at Gallipoli - as we didn't want to lug suitcases across Turkey we enquired as to booking a room for that night (which we hadn't done). Not a problem. So all our bags including travel companions went into that room and off we went. Breakfast was great with a wide selection of foods. The only complaint was that the coffee machine wasn't working properly (not hot enough and only half filled cups) and the hot chocolate was unavailable for the kids! Not to worry - coffee came around with the staff so all good! Plenty of room in the restaurant although there was o tour group there on our last day and the tables were starting to run out. ON tour groups - whilst the foyer area is adequate - when there are lots of people trying to get checked in at the same time, it can become crowded as they mill around the desk - this says more about the ignorance of some travellers as it was difficult to get through the crowd to get to the elevators. Perhaps tour guides can organise their groups to stand away from the access area so as not to inconvenience others staying at the hotel. The Spa/Hamam was fantastic although we went in there with our two daughters which was a little awkward when confronted with naked men. I think bathing suits should be a must if children are allowed in. Some adults also find public nudity confronting so consideration whould be given to this! (SOme people really should't be wearing just their bathing suits if you know what I mean!) All the staff were helpful and extremely friendly. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location for walking Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sirbrianmorgan
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Saray Hotel was the absolute perfect position in the old city for walking to all the major historic site-seeing locations and for those looking to visit next years Turkish F1 Grandprix it was also the perfect hotel F1 transfer busses only 10 minutes walk down the main street to the bus station holding a constant stream of dedicated circuit transfer buses at an unbelievable ticket price of only Â£3 each way. It was a one and a half hour bus journey through the city and countryside to the circuit, it was unbelievable good value with virtually no queuing. The hotel organised airport transfers at 30 Euro each way (the vehicle would seat at least 6 people, i.e. 5 Euro each) this was very helpful as our flight arrival and departures were in the early hours of the morning. As mentioned in other guest comments the breakfast was just outstanding, with a selection of fruit juices & cereals, 5 different cheeses, cold meats/salamis, olives, chopped chilli salad, tinned fruit & fresh fruit with a selection of yogurts. If that wasnâ€™t sufficient there was also a hot selection of sweet pancakes with various jams and honeys and a hot savoury offering of scrambled eggs, fried eggs, boiled eggs and sautÃ© potatoes with grilled pieces of sausage. This followed with a selection of breads and oriental cakes such as baklava etc. Coffee & Tea flowed on demand. This coupled with a lovely view from the breakfast balcony of the Mosque and gardens. We had a standard room that was very comfortable with a safe in the wardrobe for valuables at no charge and a well stocked mini bar that we only used to store milk for our tea and coffee that we made with our travel kettle.(No tea & coffee facilities provided in the room) Negatives â€“ the hotel evening meal was pretty average for the price compared to the many Traditional Turkish meals on offer at the hundreds of restaurants in the immediate area. The room was a little hot as we couldnâ€™t fathom how to get the air-conditioning to cool it, not too much of a problem we slept with the balcony door open. The mosque woke you at 5am but you will get that wherever you stay in Istanbul as there is a mosque on every street corner! I would defiantly use this hotel again. Brian Morgan - West Yorkshire.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for tourists - particularly first-timers to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Bollards15
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Saray is a modern, well-located hotel in terms of Istanbul's amazing Ottoman period mosques, palaces, museums, Grand Bazaar ( directly opposite the main entrance) and right on the efficient tramway service which dissects the Old City and then crosses the Galata Bridge and goes all the way up to Taksim Square on the Asian side of the Bosphorus. The hotel (Standard) room was of reasonable size with a clean well equipped bathroom.The bright and friendly staff -all of whom we dealt with spoke very good English- had a "...nothing is too much trouble" attitude to guests. Breakfast on the roof terrace was of a high standard and the views were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for location and service”
Reviews.Author: Reviewed_for_you
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a really odd shape and you enter via an escalator down to reception. It is clean and the staff are truly superb, I am hard to please but I truly cannot fault this hotel for the location, breakfast and excellent staff. The cleaning ladies are jolly and the waiters and waitresses very accommodating. I would stay here again and so would the rest of my fellow travellers. The staff really cannot do enough for you. The odd layout just reminds you that you are in Istanbul where nothing is predictable. We will be back in September to this amazing city and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hiden Gem”
Reviews.Author: dougrh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. Do request a room facing the outside/ street if you are able too. If not all rooms face an interior closed atrum. Very clean attentive staff. Sort of strange when you first arrive as you enter mostly down an escalator in a shopping center. There is a side entrance too. The roof top dining room is great with an amazing view. Almost across the street from the Bazar entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff & location.”
Reviews.Author: Dundeetravellers_8
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with the 98% of the other reviews.This hotel is superb, in a great location to all areas of Istanbul & 10 minutes walk to some fine restaurants. The staff were superb & so helpful. The rooms were always cleaned each day & the breakfast was varied & taste each day. The tram service just outside was great for travelling across the river to the other parts of Istanbul. The noise was just like a typical city, so no real issues there. AGAIN, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. You will not be dissapointed. :)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_C_London186338
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week in Istanbul, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone else! The room was spacious and clean, the bathroom always kept spotless. Excellent and varied Breakfast, and the restaurant has a stunning view over the city. The Hotel is perfectly located to visit the many attraction of the city. Easy walking distance to Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Archeological Museum etc. The Grand Bazaar is literally across the street. There are great transport connections just outside the Hotel, such as the ultramodern tram, and buses and taxis. The best point about the Hotel however were the staff. Always helpful, polite, professional. We could not have found a better Hotel, it made our holiday totally unforgettable. Well done to all the staff at the Hotel, and I could not single out any specific member of staff. They all had very high standards in friendly welcoming of the guests!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: HollySSC
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul. The hotel is a great location: near to public transport and walking distance to the cultural attractions of the old town. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean, the rooms were stylish and comfortable with great showers. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - after we had checked out on our last day, they agreed to store our bags and when we appeared two hours later soaking wet having been caught in a rain storm, they were happy to retrieve our bags and let us use the showers to warm up (thanks to Baver and Arzu for this!) even though we had already technically left.

Reviews.Title: “Good medium type hotel close to the old city”
Reviews.Author: valdemoril
Reviews.Content: It is a decent hotel within walking distance from the Grand Bazaar and Ayasofia. The recepcionists speak Spanish (I mention that just because that's my mother tongue) and are pretty nice. The views from the premium rooms in the fourth floor are beautiful: request room 413 if you can get a good price for it. Free internet in all rooms. Breakfast needs to be improved though: they serve an awful chemical orange drink which is a shame when you can get fresh orange juice at every street corner. The variety of the breakfast does not meet expectations. On my second day I chose to have breakfast in a nice cafeteria nearby down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: adandanita
Reviews.Content: What wonderful staff! I have just got backl from 5 days in Istanbul with friends and the staff at this superbly located hotel (next to the Grand Bazar and a short walk to the Blue Mosque etc) could not have been more friendly or helpful. Every night we went out they arranged taxis, ensuring the taxi driver understood where we were going and that we know the maximun price the journey would be. They were friendly andaccomodating and all in all made the trip a real pleaseure - so thank you Baver, Marmed (sorry can't remeber the spelling) and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Exceptional Location”
Reviews.Author: Storyshore
Reviews.Content: We discovered this hotel after wandering the streets of Istanbul during our first Visit. It is located near all the other major 5 star hotels with the same view and location attributes. The comfort and quality of the Rooms and Breakfast is right up there with the 5 start competition without the stuffy service. Wonderful service and the quickest room make up ever. Only negative is it is right across from a Large Mosque so the morning call to prayer is a wake up at 5am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service”
Reviews.Author: ITQ
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with the booking, but they relocated us for one night at their other hotel (five stars, but far away from the center). The day after a taxi took us to Barcelo Saray, right in front of the Grand Bazar, walking distance to Agia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Perfect location to discover the city, a tram stop right at the door, nice hammam, friendly atmosphere, big bathroom, great breakfast... A good choice, great quality/price relation. The only bad thing, it didn't have a night bar...

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location for seeing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MrRedLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day visit to Istanbul, booked Barcelo Saray for the central old town location and value for money rate, was initially slightly nervous as rate seemed 15-20% below other hotels in area but after seeing good reviews on here, went for it anyway. What we liked: Location-right in centre of old town. Proximity-easy to get to all of the main attractions ( Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Bascillica, Royal Place etc etc). Service-All staff we met were courteous, friendly and Helpful. Excellant Transport Links Decent Breakfast Quiet Superb leisure club inc.steam room, sauna and Hamam Clean Safe Location with 24hr reception and 24hr Concierge/doorman Short tram ride from Bosphorus What we didn't like: Nothing really....rooms were a little small but minor gripe really as they were clean and well laid out with decent bathroom. Overall, whilst this hotel doesn't blow you away, i cannot find anything to fault it with, location is perfect for tourists (although maybe not for business as on wrong side of financial area) and they do everything right in a sort of undertstated way, despite being in centre of Itsanbul, you always felt safe and secure at hotel. Service was very good ad superb Hamam became a haven at end of day touring. Would definatley recommend, think we just got lucky with the rate. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with ideal location for a short break in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: MariSian
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on a midweek break to Istanbul and this hotels location is ideal for visiting the main sites and eating out in the city. We had booked a deluxe room with sea view and the first room we were shown was a corner room on the third floor. The porter could not find the tv remote control so decided to move us up to the room above on the fourth floor. this room was the same as the one below but had two windows so had a better view of the sea. Tried the spa for a turkish bath and thought it was resonable for 120 euros for two. Great view from the roof top restaurant. Only downside was the showerhead being loose and being woken by the call to prayer but that must be the case in most hotels in the centre of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: nate58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barcelo Saray for three nights in early February. The hotel is perfectly situated in the old city with major sites within easy walking distance. The tram is a block from the hotel which makes getting around even easier. Breakfast was great and an excellent value. Internet access was included in the room rate. Use of the spa (wet and dry sauna) also included in the room rate. Room was very large, the only downside was a slight smell of mildew in the bathroom we could smell after showering. That said, it wasn't a big deal and I would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous28970
Reviews.Content: A three-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and walking distance (and right by the tram) to the major sites. Rooms are small, but the location, service, great breakfast, and price make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff made our time in istanbul very enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: anita065
Reviews.Content: After a long day travelling, the staff were very welcoming and friendly. Hotel was clean and quiet. The location was also great as we could walk around most of the old part of the city quite easily. What stood out though was the helpfulness of the staff particularily Arzu at the desk who helped us find places, helped us with our Turkish and did so with a smile. Baver was also a nother name that stood out as someone who was willing to assist with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel to stay at in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LouisaSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at this hotel from 19th Dec. It was clean, service was great and no problems at all. The hotel is very close to Grand Bazaar. Staff were all very helpful and we are sad that we didnt stay longer instead we had another hotel booked for a further 5 days that you couldnt compare. Barcelo Saray has steam and sauna, hamam and massage service. Rooms cleaned daily and food was good. You wont be sorry, book this hotel. You will learn the tram and train service quick quick. The location of the hotel as well as the quality and value for money is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near Grand Bazaar with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: We booked a Mosque View room at the BarcelÃ³ Saray for our trip to Istanbul. The view of Beyazit Mosque from the room is absolutely beautiful (as it is from the restaurant too), but unfortunately there were road works going on all night while we were there, so we moved to a Marmara Sea View instead. The staff could not have been more helpful and moved everything for us. I would highly recommend the Mosque View Room, it was just bad luck about the roadworks. The rooms in this hotel are very modern with big beds. The hamam (Turkish bath) in the hotel is very nice and we used it to relax after a demanding day of sightseeing. The staff were all very welcoming, offered a consistently high standard of customer service and spoke Turkish, English and Spanish. The hotel isn't exactly in a cultural or historical building, but I like the clean, Spanish style of BarcelÃ³ and great free wifi! It's not entirely in the heart of the tourist area, but it's very near the Grand Bazaar and only a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and all the other main attractions. The tram stop is a couple of minutes walk away and gets you everywhere really fast. I would probably try out the Miapera Hotel if I'm lucky enough to visit Istanbul again in the near future, but that's simply because I'd like to be near the Tunel area for the evenings. I would definitely stay at the BarcelÃ³ Saray again and recommend it to anyone who wants to be near the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very helpful staff, made us feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: richard_aleixo
Reviews.Content: Hotel very central, Grand Bazaar only 200 metres, blue Mosque 15 mins walk, staff helpful and friendly & couldn't do enough for us. It is a very busy city and alot going on can be a bit noisy but did not put us off.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1982GR
Reviews.Content: Been to Istanbul last november and i can say that concerning the hotel,the location of barcelo saray is the ideal for starting from my journeys around Istanbul!Just outside the hotel u can take the very convenient tram,or bus or taxi,or just walk 5 min to the grand bazaar or a bit more to the Ayia Sofia and the rest nearby monuments!the room we got was on the side of the hotel,which was what we have booked,the view was not the best since from the window(not really a balcony) u could ses some construction works were made at that time.was not that big really but for us was fine,clean and in good condition.besides didnt spent much time in it. restaurant at the top was great to have breakfast with a very nice view of the area,especially in summer it must be great since ull be able to eat outside. staff were fine,in restaurant the waitresses were smiling and helpful.the only very small dissapointment was that once we had a drink at the hotel bar,we had to pay a fortune for a bacardi orange because they charged it like 2 seperate drinks which ok i know some bars do it like this ofcourse but in this case they should also bring them seperately... In general i think the hotel for someone who wants to discover Istanbul and not spend all his time in hotel is fine! ps:a tip for istanbul,for sure take an akbil for your transportation around the town!its this small magnet u buy from kioks and u can fill it in with credits that u can use in all the public transports even boats which are so cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, wonderful service, great experience”
Reviews.Author: alwaysexcessbaggage
Reviews.Content: this review comes a little late but am a recent member to this forum and wanted to share our great experience of this place.. we had a nice room which had a wonderful view of the gorgeous beyazit mosque..one heard the beautiful prayercalls morning and evening, which is such an integral part of istanbul experience!! the location was just right to explore the historic center on foot..the tram station was just on the doorstep,making it so convenient to go to far out areas..lots of small restaurants of traditional turkish food in this area.. the staff was ever so helpful and pleasant..the top floor breakfast area was flooded with natural light and with a view of the mosque dome.. it is a no frills hotel,indeed..and perhaps without any special ambience or charm..but it makes a perfectly comfortable base to explore istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ask for the large room with view to Marmara Sea”
Reviews.Author: axelm71
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very close to the Grand Bazaar. If you are looking for local atmosphere this is not your place. But the service is good, the hotel is clean and the rooms with view to the Marmara Sea are superb. The breakfast is ok but again the views while having your morning coffee are beautiful. Go up the rooftop restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convenient located hotel”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: It's great hotel, with a strange entrance (inside a mall), but its very well located, right across the street from the Grand Bazaar and on the Tram.The location is perfect. The hotel offers everything a traveler needs. A lovely roof top restaurant with a great breakfast offering, a lounge bar where one could have a snack AND a FREE Sauna and Hamam. The staff is warm, friendly and helpful. (they speak better Spanish than English but that was OK for us. The room was street view, but you hardly hear any noise from the street, apart the call from the nearby mosque, but you get use to it. Good dimensions and great bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jmanandmb
Reviews.Content: The staff was so warm and helpful. We were upgraded to a huge room with a spectacular view of the sea. The restaurant was very nice, and the hours were very convenient. The hotel was a great deal for the service and accommodations we received. The hotel is right by the tram and the Grand Bazaar. It's a bit of a walk from the other sites, but it's an easy and pleasant walk. It has a modern European flavor on the minimalist side that we really liked. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Do your self a favor- Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LuvztoTravel
Reviews.Content: Small, dark rooms facing into a shopping center's atrium-with horrible air circulation. There was an air conditioning unit, but it was worthless and we spent most of the day and night sweating! ugh. There is one window you can open onto the atrium, but you can only partially open it and it cuts the AC off. I thought it was just our room, but our friends had the same experience in a different room on a different floor. Went to take a shower to cool off and found that there was black mildew spots all over the shower walls. The bathroom floors were a gray tile and you could easily see spots and dirt from the previous users- yuck! The staff was less than helpful and the one place they did recommend for us to eat at was a place that they received a commission from. When I complained about the dirt, they treated me in a very rude and sexist way, while when my friend's husband complained, they came to clean their bathroom. I thought this was the "new Middle East"?? Apparently not at this place!! Overall a very disappointing experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But No Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JimmyDoodlebug
Reviews.Content: I'm having a hard time characterizing this hotel, so I'll say what someone else said: this is a business hotel without any atmosphere. It is a modern hotel, but the layout is different than any other hotel I ever stayed in. It is located right on one of the busiest streets in the historic part of Istanbul The street has 4 traffic lanes and 2 tram tracks down the center. There is a lot of street noise. The front of the hotel looks like a streetside business office, no different than all the business around it. Only the sign on the glass indicates it is a hotel. When you enter, you are in a multistory atrium housing a shoe store, a jeweller, and two banks. In front of you is an escalator which takes you down to the hotel bar, restaurant, and the entry to the check-in area. Everything is marble or steel. The rooms are large, or at least ours were because we paid extra for something they call "double used as a single", meaning they had a double bed or two singles pushed together. Ample for two single people sleeping separately. An extremely comfortable bed, but the other furniture was sparse. Low luminosity fluourescent enrgy-saver lightbulbs made it very difficult to read and generally gloomy. The bathrooms are spacious, and there is a large closet and storage cabinet with a (small capacity) safe. There were sufficient soaps and shampoos, and everything was clean and the bedrooms were nicely carpeted. Nice big towels, but they weren't replaced daily. There was a flat screen TV, but in my room it only got European channels. My daughter got American channels as well. You don't know how much you'll miss American channels, if you're an American, until you have to watch Al Jazeera or Italian bicycle races in Italian, or Polish and German talk TV. The breakfast was really extensive, table upon table with eggs, breads, cerals, sweet baked goods, rolls, yogurts, juices and many other good things. It could be the biggest meal of the day if you wanted it to be. The restaurant has a good view of the Beyazit Mosque across the boulevard and it's quite a pleasant place to eat. As has been said by others, it is located about two short blocks from to a tram stop and also to one of the entrances to the Grand Bazaar. It's not as close to the Blue Mosque or Topkapi as I would have liked, at least a 15 minute walk or more, but you can take the very frequent trams to get there. All in all it's in a good but not outstanding location, but there is no reason to complain. If you pay extra you can get a room with a view of the mosque across the street. If you don't want to pay extra, there is a good chance your room will look down into the atrium with the escalator, and that is an ugly view. I noticed in the photos online that the busy street was right in front of the hotel rooms, so I requested to have the Marmara View instead. That means you'll be on the other side of the hotel and it's much quieter there. The view is pleasant, but there are a couple of rundown buildings right in front of your rooms that you'll be looking at. Still it's your best choice. They only have two rooms with the Marmara view, so request them specifically, 323 and 324. I think you could request that side of the hotel but without the extra fee Marmara view, but you'll be looking right into the windows of a sweatshop and other things. They were very good to give me those rooms when I asked for them. In fact the staff were very pleasant and willing to help in every way they could. So there's really not anything to complain about, as long as you request the right rooms, but the overall feel of this hotel is cold. Industrial, I guess you could say. Or maybe "functional" is the right word. I don't want to give the wrong impression, if you stay here you won't kick yourself, but I just think for a tourist making his or her first visit to Istanbul you might be better off in a more traditional hotel located a little bit closer to Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque. Last year I stayed at the Adamar Hotel, and I would have stayed there this year but it was fully booked. I recommend you check on that. I can't say anything bad about the Barcelo Saray, but I can't really give it a recommendation either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5140
Reviews.Content: I booked Barcelo Saray with Key Tours. It was in the old city of Istanbul right across the street from the Grand Bazaar and on the Tram.The location is perfect. Step out the front door hop the Tram which takes you to the Spice Market and you can board the ferry to the Asian side. Wonderful shopping at the Grand Bazaar The hotel offers everything a traveler needs. A lovely roof top restaurant with a great breakfast offering, a lounge bar where one could have a snack AND a FREE Sauna and Hamam. The Hamam is a wet heat. You can make a reservation for a Turkish bath (where they scrub you down) or a plain massage The staff is warm, friendly and helpful. I am anxious to return.

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean and nice... but no charm”
Reviews.Author: Tirilalli
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is quite central for shopping and sightiseeing, just facing the bazar, and not far from other places of interest. Tramway passes just in front of hotel, so very easy to access places of interest without the hassle of traffic. The hotel itself is very clean and good and service is excellent, with a free Hammam to the hotel's guests. Nevertheless, if you're looking for a charming place, this is not for you, as the hotel is on a large boulevard, very modern and inside a shopping center. If you're looking for service, cleanliness and easy access, then it is definitelly the place to be. Front desk reception are very nice and helpful, as well as the manager who is always here with a great smile to solve any problem you might have. Breakfast buffet is also very good and rich. The only big problem of this hotel is the noise if you're having a room on the street (it is better to ask for a room giving on the internal patio) as the tramway, as well as cars and trucks pass all night right under your window, so if you have difficulties in getting asleep, you will suffer

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honesty and concerned”
Reviews.Author: hlammersen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights and had a less funny encounter with the shoe polishers at the New Mosque square. Our frÄ±endlyness was returned by overchargÄ±ng extreemly. ReturnÄ±ng Ä±n the hotel room a lÄ±ttle pouch wÄ±th toÄ±letterÄ±es was gone from the bathroom. At the receptÄ±on we concluded Ä±t mÄ±ght have landed Ä±n the towel pÄ±le and gone lost Ä±n the laundery. The whole staff got Ä±nvolved, Ä±ncludÄ±ng the manager mr Turgut AkÄ±sÄ±k.
