We shall go back there. Fam. Lammersen The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay, friendly people I recomend saray and I will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: cyrusMadrid
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern hotel to stay, very nice people working to make you feel like home, its just 5 minutes walking to everything to see in Istanbul, Gran Bazar, Santa Sofia, Blue mosque, etc. at the hotel you will have Mehmet and Arzu at the reception they are wonderfull! the most helfull guy is Genel, at the bar you will have Sibel, she is so sweet and always smiling, make the best tea in Istanbul. I will miss her. Siroos

Reviews.Title: “Modern convenience in a magical city of history”
Reviews.Author: NinaNayar
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. walk to Grand Bazaar and historical center. Beyazit tram station across the street. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: edmbrigagao
Reviews.Content: Really good location, close to the Grand Bazaar and even closer to the tram stop. 7 to 10 min walk to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. If I ever go back to Istanbul I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalTraveller2
Reviews.Content: We only had 7 days in Turkey, and booked the Barcelo Saray for the first three. However after a brief visit to Cappadocia we chose to return here for the last 2 days of our stay. On both occasions, we found the reception staff (in particular Arzu and Margaux) very attentive to our needs. The hotel is modern style, which is hard to find in Istanbul and particularly appealed to my husband. Breakfast is served on a covered terrace with a beautiful view of the Beyazit Mosque and Beyazit square. Good variety and service. The rooms were clean and functional. An added bonus at this hotel is an inhouse spa complete with sauna, steam room and turkish bath. Internet and wifi are free for guests. Our room had a beautiful view across to the Mosque and as we enjoyed hearing the dawn Mosque song (it's all part of the atmosphere). There are other rooms with more ordinary views that are shielded from dawn mosque song. We loved the location. First of all, it's a short walk from the hotel to the Beyazit light rail. So we could use public transport to travel to the airport (60mins) as well as the historic centre and Eminonou (handy when raining). Furthermore it was just 1km from the Hagia Sofia and Sultanahmet Mosque. We liked staying in Beyazit, outside the central tourist district, as it is frequented by many Istanbullus travelling to the Beyazit Mosque, Istanbul University. There are many shops and eating options here and it's just 5 minutes walk from the grand Bazaar. It's a ten minute walk to the famous Cemberlitis spa and many 'turkish delight' shops. Strongly recommended. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: willbain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in the BarcelÃ³ Saray this October - to recover from jetlag before embarking on a 13 day tour of Western Turkey (with Trafalgar Tours - excellent, by the way!). We were very impressed by the extremely helpful and courteous service in th hotel lobby. Breakfasts were more than ample, but other meals at the hotel were a bit disappointing - we would advise visitors not to opt for demi-pension. The next best asset of this hotel is its location in the old part of Istanbul, about 200 metres from an entrance to the incredible Grand Bazaar. The hotel also arranged pickup from the airport at a reasonable fixed cost - a blessing in view of the nightmare it was to transfer from the airport during evening rush hour!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good service and location”
Reviews.Author: jody24
Reviews.Content: i stayed in barcelo saray only for one nite, front desk was extremely helpful when my local tour didn't show up, offer very early check in at 10 am even i didn't need it. Both room and lobby has FREE wireless internet access. Complimentary turkish bath. The restaurant has excellent view. Grand Bazaar just 5 mins by walking, other attraction like Hagia sophia and blue mosque only 20 mins by walking, or if u don't like walking, tram station is just 2 mins away from hotel. i love this hotel will definitely go back when i go to istanbul again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: skulnes
Reviews.Content: All in all we our stay at the Barcelo Saray hotel was "ok". No more, no less. The room (a standard) was very small. And some things in the room felt rather â€œsloppyâ€�. E.g. the toilet paper holder was almost falling down. On the other hand, the location was good ; rather close to the main sights of Istanbul and close to the tram which for a cheap price transports you. The breakfast staff was really nice and the front desk people helpful if asked. We are, however, very disappointed at the breakfast. When going to a city for sightseeing we think that a good breakfast is very important so we wonâ€™t get hungry immediately after having left the hotel. The breakfast buffet was not very good. The hot dishes were always cold and most of the bread was really, really dry. The safety box was free of charge. The Wi-Fi was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeliveable level of customer service,lovely room and view and all staff treated us with upmost hospitatlity”
Reviews.Author: UmarSaeed
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at Barcelo Saray (Istanbul) were absolutely lovely and made a trip an unforgettable experience from the minute we arrived and the lat minute we left. I personally would like to mention the Hotel Manager and every single staff member made my wifes and little Hunayn's first trip a really really enjoyable one. I would kie to state the hotel facilities and the deluxe room with the marmaris sea view room is absolutely lovely and next time we visit Turkey we will surely be staying at this hotel again. You truly have a wonderfully managed establishment. 5* to the hotel manager Turgot and Arazoo and all others Kindest Regards Saeed Family

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PadiLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nightss . we were given a small room with small bath room but persuaded the manager to change it a standard room after two nights. The recetion staff is friendly and helpful and they all spoke English. The hotel is virtually a block away from Grand Bazar and walking distance to the Blue Mosque and St Sophia. The breakfast is good and there are several restaurants allarond this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rocksy25
Reviews.Content: We travelled in Istanbul for a city break in February 2007. The Hotel (also known as Beyaz Saray - I suppose is the name prior to Barcelo take-over) is very central, only 2 tram stops away from Ayia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, in Sultanahmet. Opposite the street is one of the entrances in the Great Bazaar and the Technic University. The rooms are farely large, bathroom well equipped and if you are lucky to get a room to the street you can see the Beyazit Mosque right in front of your window (if you dislike the sound of muezins woke you up at 5a.m..... request for an interior room :)). The hotel has also a top restaurant with a nice terrace and exceptional view over the entire Sultanahmet area. We once dined in this restaurant and apart the fact that we had only one waiter for all the tables (10 or 12 I think...) he did a pretty good job and the food was decent. All around is a decent hotel in a nice central area, with decent breakfast and good helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: sporty60
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful. Do ask for a non-smoking room if necessary as our initial room reeked of smoke and also was a twin rather than a double.Reception quickly remedied this. Good location and definitely enjoyed our turkish massage with the friendly masseurs. Good buffet breakfast but evening meal (we arrived late in the evening) was not great. Do try the Hos Seda fish restaurant. Reception called a free taxi (and return ) for us . The food was great and staff brought samples of all starters and mains. Finally we pre-booked Istanbul hoteltransfers.com who were friendly and efficient. Booked with last minute and apart from delays of about an hour with our flights everything was very satisfactory. Nigel P Cheltenham

Reviews.Title: “Ok for its category”
Reviews.Author: jacopocossater
Reviews.Content: Classic interntional contemporary hotel in the really historic center of the city. The position is perfect for tourists, in front of Grand Baazar and very close to Sultanahmet. Ok for its category and for prices, not *so much* cosy but always clean with kindly people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzface74
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. The location is only one block from the Grand Bazaar and within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, St. Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Plus, it's on the tram way. The staff was exceptionally helpful and courteous. We had a budget priced room which was just fine, but not exceptional. The breakfast buffet was very good as was the ala cart dinner. Again, exceptionally good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in saunas”
Reviews.Author: sisux2
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel with good location. Easy access by walking and tram to the major tourist attractions. We had nice roomy room facing mosque, no problems with heat or air con. Breakfast was plentiful. The best part of staying here was the saunas (free for hotel guests). It was so nice to relax in the saunas after long day walking around the city. We would stay her again There is a basic local restaurant near by called Istanbul International with good food/value. Take first street on right hand side after the tram stop and walk down the street (maybe gedik pasa street), the restaurant is on right hand side. Be careful: We asked the reception to call us a taxi to the airport. They said it is fixed price 30euros, but the driver tried to charge us more when we got out of the taxi at the airport. Do not pay more, 30euros is already too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: wazza747
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out. I had booked with the hotel directly and as I had booked 3 nights I was availed the free transfer with the driver waiting for me outside the customs area once the fun immigration scrum was finished. Arriving early in the morning from Australia I was pleased to be told they had organised a room for me to be available at check-in. After 23 hours of flying this was most welcome. I had also been upgraded to a water view room. The room was very comfortable with ample hanging space and enough area for suite cases etc. Breakfast at the hotel was fantastic with a brilliant assortment of hot and cold foods. Being a Spanish chain the catering had somewhat of a slant towards things like churros, fritata etc but all in all the food was brilliant. The view from the top floor where breakfast is served is also great. The hotel is in a great location only a few meters from a tram stop and seconds to the grand bazzar and some great turkish delight stalls. It is possible to walk to things like the Obelisk and Blue Mosque although you would be looking 15-20mins. A nice stroll though. The front desk at this hotel is downstairs in a mall but do not let this fool you, the hotel is first class and I will be staying here every time I go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Alface
Reviews.Content: Moden boutique hotel 50 m from the tram stop and a 100 m to the Grand Bazar. Our room was big and with a panoramic frontal view of the Beyazit Mosque you could take photos and make postcards from it. Also nice large bathroom and excelent breakfast. 3 computers in the loby with FREE INTERNET acess along with free use of the Haman were pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Across from Grand Bazaar- well priced”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: It's advertized as boutique/city chic and while it's trying to be that, it is not quite there yet in its decor but getting there. The rooms are comfortable, have decent intl tv, come with extra pillows and blankets and are well conditioned. They need a bit of an update but they are clean and the bathroom has everything you need except a hair dryer. The steam room is hotter than most, the sauna not so much. Free wifi throughout the hotel. It's located right across the street from the grand bazaar, 10-15 minute walk from blue mosque/hagia sofia, near restaurants, sweets shops. I recommend walking right through the bazaar to land in the larger outdoor shopping area visited mostly by locals. Streets are sloped so walk down, taxi up. Beyond this area is the galata bridge and the docks for boat tours up and down the bosphorus and to the black sea. It's an ecclectic neighbourhood with not much english or other foreign languages spoken. If you feel like smelling, tasting, walking Turkey among Turks, this is a good location, We liked it. The call to prayer echoes from all sides as the hotel is near many important mosques. It's lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and super convenient!”
Reviews.Author: chopinnlux
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very near the tourist sights such as the Blue Mosque and directly across the street from the Grand Bazaar! You will find it very convenient to travel around Istanbul from Barcelo Saray as the tram station is right outside your hotel entrance! However, do note that the standard rooms are small BUT they are decorated with modern furnishings and absolutely spotless!!

Reviews.Title: “A modern well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoREM
Reviews.Content: I took a group of seven to Isanbul for six nights following on from seven nights in Anatolia. I wanted an hotel in town within walking distance of main attractions. This hotel on Ordu Caddesi was ideal with the University, bus station, Beyazit Mosque, the Beyazit Gate to the Kapali Carsi just across the road and the University Staion of the modern tramway just outside. This modern hotel is very well appointed and furnished and very efficiently managed. The passenger activated elevators and the Otis lifts are impressive. The latter are the best designed and fastest lifts I have come across. Good points. Locked baggage room, digital safes in rooms, help with baggage, well dressed friendly staff and English newspapers. Buffet breakfasts were excellent. Bad points. Bathroom shelves far too small. Cheapest housewine Â£20.00 a bottle. Table d'hote four course dinners were unimaginative and often badly presented. The menu for the day was never published or displayed. I would stay here again but on a B&B basis as the evening meals were dismal and expensive especially as there are at least fifty places to eat within easy walking distance which are atmospheric and much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but cleanliness not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: mramo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barcelo Saray for one night from 10th to 11th August. The hotel looked impressive & the rooms are spacious & well designed. Unfortunately, the cleanliness is not so good. There were only 2 pillows on our king-size bed, so we took the other 2 pillows from the cupboards to use. Even though both these pillows were wrapped in plastic & we just checked in (late 10pm), we realized that both pillows smelt of sweat. We also found hairs of the previous room occupants in the bedding. We were too tired to complain as we spent a whole day travelling & it was already 10pm, so we slept in the dirty sheets. The hotel also did not allow us a late check-out the next day even though we checked in at 10pm the night before, and our flight only departs at 11.25pm the next day. When we asked for a one hour extension, they also did not agree to it. We probably won't stay here again, even though the location was very good - only 2 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities and pretty good service”
Reviews.Author: goetz_r
Reviews.Content: Let me get to the "pretty good" from the title first. The service in the restaurant was good, quick, efficient and friendly. This was not the case in the bar next to the lobby, one should opt for the rooftop restaurant if one wants to eat in the hotel. The facilities were very well appointed, the whole hotel is very modern in terms of design and furniture. Beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. If there is one negative issue I would say it's the missing space to put things in the bathrooms, e.g. shaver, cremes, etc.. The location of the hotel is excellent, 5min walking to the Grand Bazar. A tramstation is next to the hotel, so it's very easy to get into all parts of the city within minutes, the Dolmabahce Palace for example, even though it's not worth visiting, is 10 to 15min by tram. All in all I think that the hotel is very nice, it get's 4 stars from me because it is officially a 4 star hotel and offers everything it is supposed to offer. I don't give more because there is nothing that is extraordinary in terms of service or facilites, it's simply well made. If you're visiting Istanbul for the first time or want to stay on the Golden Horn, this is one of the places to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: moaksey
Reviews.Content: We looked around for a reasonable hotel in Istanbul and found quite a few (the Marmara Pera etc). However, we waited until a week before we left to book and all prices shot up - doubling in some cases. We found the Barcelo Saray and it looked pretty good. The reviews on tripadvisor sounded great too so we gave it a shot. Location... The hotel is in the old part of town and is perfectly located for seeing the Grand Bazaar, the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque etc. You're within walking distance of all the major sites - and the sea too. The hotel's website makes the claim that it's 200m from the Grand Bazaar - I think it's way closer actually (even better). The tram is right in front of the hotel and you're not bang in the middle of a tourist trap so the taxis won't rip you off. The hotel is around 30 minutes from the airport, which was easy. We stayed 3 nights so qualified for the free airport pickup which was awesome. On the way back the taxi cost YTL30. Facilities... The hotel has such a strange lay-out, but it is pretty good. Some of the rooms face inwards and their windows open into a central, covered courtyard. Glad we didn't have one of these. We were at the back of the hotel and faced the street behind. The views from the front of the hotel are much better. Food... A buffet breakfast is included, but was quite disappointing. It tried to be more than a continental breakfast but let itself down I think. We arrived at around 10 each morning and most of the hot selection had ran out. The hot food choices were quite strange too (noodles with meat, deep fried bread, boiled egg, fried egg, etc). However, I'm comparing this to places we visit in Thailand each year - hotels I'd visit just for the amazing breakfasts! Realistically speaking the food was good. Staff... The staff were great. They were all really helpful and friendly. They should come to London and train our hotels... Rooms... Our room was a good size. It was really clean and modern. The minibar was well-stocked (although expensive... the cans aren't marked so you can replace them if you need to). The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was huge... and modern. There were plenty of channels available on TV, but when we turned ours on, it was always on full volume - very strange. Noise... We were in a room at the back of the hotel and it was really quiet. The whole hotel seemed like it was empty - which it wasn't. No noise problems here at all! Decor... I liked the overall feel of the hotel. The colour scheme was good. I liked the carpets quite a lot. Guests... The hotel seems to cater for tourists from Spain and Portugal, however, everything was in English - and the staff spoke more English than anything else. There were a few groups from Spain when we were there - and a big one from the US. However, the groups weren't too much and the majority of guests were couples or families. One last thing... We're a gay couple and were given a double bed without even asking for it. At no point in the registration process do I remember requesting one either. This was a really nice surprise - not something I expected! I hadn't heard of the Bacelo chain before, and they were heavily into promoting all their other properties around the hotel. I'd try them again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for full Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: almondblossom
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the Barcelo Saray Hotel for 8 nights. The room was very comfortable but lacked coffee making facilities. The bathroom was clean, spacious and well equipped. The breakfast each morning was buffet style and was sumptuous. The breakfast room overlooked a beautiful mosque and the food and coffee was plentiful, fresh and delicious. An eclectic range of soft music was played during breakfast. This ranged from classical music to gentle rock and roll. The staff were efficient and always helpful in relation to any need eg ironing, laundry, ordering transport and any minor maintenance. Our safe was fixed soon after reporting that it was faulty. Internet was available and free of charge. This hotel provided excellent access to all the wonders of Istanbul ie walking distance to major tourist sites. In the evening, for an hour each night, lovely piano music wafted through the hotel via a pianist, playing a grand piano on the first floor, where one could also have a pleasant drink. The food in the Bistro was also excellent, along with the service from the waiters and barmen. We wished that we could have taken the Barcelo Saray around Turkey with us, as we truly missed the comfort , the breakfast and staff of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Freedomtogo
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Barcelo Saray. It's in the Beyazit district near the Grand Bazaar and across the street from a huge mosque. The tram stop is a couple of blocks away, and the main street is busy with shops and restaurants. And it only takes 14 minutes to walk to the Sultanhemet. We timed it for this review! The hotel is modern and owned by a Spanish chain. I must compliment the Barcelo for its reservation system, free pick-up from the airport if you stay four nights or more, and the great service from a staff who are fun, engaging and friendly. English is spoken by a few of them. We stayed at the Saray five nights, four when we arrived in Istanbul and one before we left. Both rooms were small, but comfortable and clean. In both rooms were two single beds pushed together, a big closet, safe, mini-bar and TV with BBC and CNN. The bathroom had a walk-in shower, small sink, shelf, hairdryer and some soaps, etc. There was a big window that opens, A/C and room service. The Saray has a cafe and bar by the lobby. I had a burger, which was made of veal, and was pretty good. Plus beer. The most popular beer is Efes and it's pretty good beer! There is a restaurant on the top floor with a view of one of the many mosques in Istanbul. Breakfast was served here, and it was the biggest buffet spread we had in Turkey. Cheeses, cold meats, various types of olives, cereal, apricots, cherrie,s yogurt, breads and some hot items lik scrambled eggs and wedge potatoes. Plus, REAL coffee with hot milk, not Nescafe. We ate at the restaurant for dinner our last night. My lamb chops were excellent, my husband's beef filet not so much. There's a lesson to be learned here. We paid $190 USD per night including breakfast, and I think it was worth it. TIP: Smile. The Turkish people are friendly and hospitable. Sour pusses are boring!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Magic_Carpet_Ride
Reviews.Content: The Barcelo Saray is part of a Spanish chain catering mainly to Spanish and Italian tourists visiting Istanbul. The rooms are en-suite and are comfortable (I'd recommend carrying your own stock of toileteries). Our rate included breakfast and was decent fare. The hotel overlooks one of the many mosques that dot the Istanbul skyline and is right opposite the Grand Bazaar and next to a tram station that is two stops from the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Sarayi and Haghia Sofia. The location therefore is ideal. Service is average. If you book directly via the hotel website you will get a free pick up from the airport. Do not bank on a great view as this is reserved for those who are paying rack rate and not going through a travel website. Service is average (not rude but friendly either). Do not book any tours through the hotel as these tend to be slightly expensive compared to what the tour operator in the market will give you.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: traveller_spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights in Istanbul, 3 at the Barcelo Saray and 3 at the BW President which is very near and both are 4 stars. - HOTEL: looks very new, comfortable with a restaurant on the roof and a bar close to reception, free sauna, steam bath and turskish bath opened from 15 to 23h, free WIFI and business room with 3 computers. Friendly and helpful staff. - ROOM: looks very new and has big bathroom but the room is very small, you can almost no move or place your case. It is very silent at night. You have free WIFI. - BREAKFAST: it was good but there was not enough choice of warm dishes and fresh fruit, no fresh juices. - RESTAURANT: I had dinner once as that day I spent 12 hours walking and after a sauna and Turkish bath I preferred to stay at hotel. Good food and dessert and average price. Nice views to Bezayit Mosque from the roof. - LOCATION: located next to Bezayit Square and Grand Bazaar. It is at a walking distance to most highlights in the old city and you have a tram stop in front of hotel. - AIRPORT TRANSFER/DROP-OFF: if you stay 3 nights or more and book it through their page you get this service free. I reserved though a Turkish website which offered this service for free and better hotel price. I paid 80 for the Barcelo Saray and with the exception of the room size and got an slightly better hotel than from the BW which I paid 149 euros (F1 price was going on and this hotel was full). Istanbul is quite expensive, so I think I got a good value for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grahamrj
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice smart hotel and good value

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: texantasha
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based upon previous travellers reviews and its convenient location. I wasn't disappointed with that, it was a mere 10-15 minute walk to the Sultanahmet district. This hotel does have a quirky and European feel to it, nothing 'chain' about this one, which made for a pleasant change. Very basic in terms of room amenities but adequate. We enjoyed the steam room and sauna each evening, didn't try the Hammam. Breakfast was plentiful, much better choice than I had anticipated and the view from the restaurant is very pleasant. Hotel staff does appear a little surly, however, when we pointed out to them how the taxi service that they had ordered for us one evening had 'ripped us off' they called us to reception the next morning with a reimbursement. We were pleasantly surprised by that, as it was totally unexpected and appreciated their honesty. Our room was on the third floor, right next to the elevator and had a balcony area - highly recommend it. There was a lot of construction work taking place at the side of the hotel (and opposite our room) from 5.00 a.m until 6.00 p.m. Hopefully that will halt by the time you take your trip there but do check! We had dinner one night at 'Asitane' booked for us by the hotel. It is traditional Ottoman style cuisine, with very delicate flavours and ingredients, worth a try and management very friendly. The dawn light around the hotel and in to Sultanahmet district is wonderful, try and get out early to revel in it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Small trendy hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: larkenRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: At first glance from the outside, this hotel is not impressive but the inside is modern, simple and clean. The room was compact but it had a queen sized bed and the furniture was modern, it almost had an asian look to it. The restraunt was on the top floor and it overlooked the Beyazit mosque. Breakfast was excellent with a good variety of foods. There was also a lobby bar/restraunt with good pizza and soups. An atm machine was right there as was a computer room and the hotel had its' own turkish bath. When we travel, especially in a city location, is very important to be able to move about easily and safely.This hotel had an excellent location. We were right across from the Grand Bazaar, the Beyazit Mosque and Istanbul University. We were within several blocks of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Bascillica cisterne and Topkapi palace and the spice bazaar. The train line and subway were close by and we took easy trips to Taksim. We were able to walk almost everywhere or pick up additional forms of transportation to sail up the Bosphorous to the asian side or explore other areas. Although the area around the hotel was very busy with people and traffic, it was very safe. We never felt uneasy or threatened. The people of the city and in the hotel were extremely pleasant and helpful. Several times we walked up to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia at night to enjoy the lights and the city atmosphere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience the city first hand and stay in a place that is comfortable, convenient, clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Facilities, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: HipsterGirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the rave reviews on TripAdvisor and I must agree that the location is outstanding if you're the kind of holidaymaker who likes to walk around and explore. The hotel is situated on a very busy main throughfare in the Beyazit district. Come out of the hotel entrance and turn right. Carry on down the main road and in 10-15 minutes' time, you'll be in the Sultanahmet district where most of the main historical sites are: the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia, the Hippodrome, the Archaeological Museum, the Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern are all within minutes of each other within the Sultanahmet region. But be warned, the Beyazit district is much cheaper when it comes to eating out and plenty of excellent restaurants can be found down the steep side streets on the hotel side of the main road. You'll also find plenty of cafes and eating places on the main road as you head into Sultanahmet, although the price may rise accordingly. Across the road from the hotel entrance is the Grand Bazaar, a madhouse filled with hundreds of shops selling all the things you never knew you needed (or wanted)! Trams run along this main road, and you'll often see buses and taxis whizzing around, which makes the hotel location handy for transport links. Breakfast at the Barcelo Saray is the usual continental fare: fruit juices (cordials, not freshly squeezed), cereal, cold meats, salad, a very small selection of hot food, and plenty of bread. It's served inside a restaurant on the rooftop so you are treated to a beautiful view of the nearby Ottoman baroque-style mosque across the street. The hotel also houses a sauna and steam room, free to guests, plus the opportunity for a hamam experience (at cost). You can request airport-hotel transfer by e-mailing the hotel beforehand unless you book your stay through them directly. Although other reviewers were charged 30 lira for the transfer, we were charged a whopping 43 lira each way on our visit. Although, it must be said, the hotel driver assigned to us was wonderful and very friendly and welcoming. Unfortunately for us, we did not find the hotel staff particularly friendly. Although language was a barrier for us, we smiled as we communicated but almost every member of staff we interacted with, whether on reception or in the restaurant, was off-hand. Not sure if it was because we were Chinese (although from the UK), because we noticed other guests of Spanish, German etc origin seemed to receive more helpful and attentive service than us. Perhaps it all went downhill when we the porter first took our luggage to the room and we didn't have any change at the beginning of our holiday to tip him on the spot! Of course, it may just be a cultural factor (we had similar experiences of 'indifference' in restaurants and venues outside of the hotel) or a misperception on our part. However, the hotel staff offered an efficient, clinical service that was adequate to our needs. Communication in English was minimal, but the hotel has no problem attracting guests of varying nationalities. Barcelo Saray offers good basic room facilities: hairdryer, generous shower room (no bath in ours), TV, fridge, electronic safe, quiet environment. On the minus side, no tea/coffee making facilities, few toiletries including cotton buds and make-up pads but no bathrobe or slippers. The decor is clean and minimalist. The carpet in our room was grotty and in need of a steam-clean, but the furniture and bedding was spotless. Overall, the location is excellent. The steam and sauna rooms are a bonus and the rooms are quiet. These factors made it an above average stay for me, although the room facilities make this hotel more of a good 3-star than 4-star. But regardless of location and facilities, a friendly welcome and friendlier service would have gone a long way to make us feel like we were staying at a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: AlamTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located close by to the major sightseeing sites. You walk out and you are 200 meters away from the Grand Bazaar. I would highly recommend you stay on the Grand Bazaar side of Istanbul, not on the Galata or worse the Asian side of Istanbul. Asian side is basically like any US suburb.Nothing of the uniqueness of Istanbul. The hotel is part of a Spanish chain. It attracts a lot of Spanish travelers. Maybe it is just me: these folks are chain smokers. People smoke anywhere and everywhere, including during breakfast, without any hint of consideration for others. The smoking was a major minus, probably the only minus. WIFI high speed connection was free in the room: finally the FIRST hotel in Europe with a free internet connection. Miracle. The room was standard, with an inside view. Super quiet. The AC was neverthless extremely noisy. It smelled cigarette smoke as I doubt the previous tenants cared much about the non-smoking sign. Much of the building/rooms/public areas looked fresh and new. The staff was fine. You will have to deal with the Turkish mindset whereby everything is a haggling match/game. The porter ordered a taxi for us. When we asked him for the price to the airport, it was 30 Liras. When the taxi arrived, it changed to 35 Liras. Most of what you will encounter is petty: street vendor selling bread sticks for 50 cents lira but will try to get 75 cents from you. Haggling is a game in Istanbul. It is about how much a vendor can apply price elasticity to every single customer. It is PRICELINE.COM but outdoors!!! *smile* Don't get offended. Nothing personal. They now seem to have thousands of Ukrainian and Russian customers all too willing to buy not one shirt or 2 pairs of shoes but by the dozen. I guess they resell the bulk back home at a handsome profit. I would go back to this hotel on my next visit. It gives you the feelign you are in the middle of everything. November weather was awesome. I could not stand the Summer heat in this town. Hotel has AC though. There is a hammam downstairs which we never used. The TV is worthless and we had no time to watch it: too much to do outdoors. The breakfast was ok. Inclusive of the price we paid. The juices were awful: chemical taste. It was a typical breakfast you'd find at a spanish hotel in Spain. Again, decent but nothing to be amazed about. There is a safe in the room. There is also a fridge you can use to store your drinks. We paid 80 Euros a night. By the way, the USD has basically lost all respect! Merchants would rather take Euros. Be careful about the multitude of quotes in different currencies. You have to juggle USD/EUR/Lira constantly to ensure no one takes advantage of you. I have a dream: a fair price clearly advertised by all vendors in Turkey. I think we would h ave spent another $2000 were the vendors more honest in their pricing.

Reviews.Title: “A travel Experience”
Reviews.Author: tripSouthPasadena_Ca
Reviews.Content: After Mykonos we flew to Istanbul, Thanks to Ender, our travel agent at Kivoto's Aegean Agency he had set us up at the "Barcelo saray Hotel". His planning couldn't have been better, he took care of every detail to our satisfaction. The transfers in each city to our hotels were prompt and with courteous and helpful people.The hotel was fantastic, centrally located and right across from the Blue Mosque. The rooms were a bit small but the service was superb. They have an excellent retaurant "the Vista" on the top floor which is very elegant with an excellent and tasty menu and it has huge picture windows that overlook the Blue Mosque. It is very impressive at night all lit up. We enjoyed the Call to prayer throughout the day. The best part of the hotel is that it was very close to all the historical sights in the city. And shopping! I couldn't stay out of the Grand Bazaar especially because it was so close to the hotel I could make several trips back and forth. This is a city we will also visit again ,Ender, it was great!
